verses.kjv: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a flock; thou that dwellest between the cherubims, shine forth.
verses.ct: Listen, Shepherd of Israel, you who guide Joseph like a flock. You who sit enthroned above the cherubim, radiate your glory.

verses.kjv: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength, and come and save us.
verses.ct: In the presence of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, unleash your power and come to rescue us.

verses.kjv: Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
verses.ct: Restore us, God, and look on us with favor, and we will be saved.

verses.kjv: O LORD God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the prayer of thy people?
verses.ct: LORD God of Armies, how long will you be angry with the prayers of your people?

verses.kjv: Thou feedest them with the bread of tears; and givest them tears to drink in great measure.
verses.ct: You have fed them with the bread of tears and made them drink tears by the bowlful.

verses.kjv: Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours: and our enemies laugh among themselves.
verses.ct: You have made us something our neighbors fight over, and our enemies mock us among themselves.

verses.kjv: Turn us again, O God of hosts, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
verses.ct: Restore us, God of Armies, and look on us with favor, and we will be saved.

verses.kjv: Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the heathen, and planted it.
verses.ct: You transplanted a vine from Egypt; you drove out the nations and planted it in their place.

verses.kjv: Thou preparedst room before it, and didst cause it to take deep root, and it filled the land.
verses.ct: You cleared the ground for it, and it took deep root and spread across the whole land.

verses.kjv: The hills were covered with the shadow of it, and the boughs thereof were like the goodly cedars.
verses.ct: Its shade covered the mountains, and its branches were like mighty cedars.

verses.kjv: She sent out her boughs unto the sea, and her branches unto the river.
verses.ct: It stretched its limbs to the Mediterranean Sea and its shoots all the way to the Euphrates River.

verses.kjv: Why hast thou then broken down her hedges, so that all they which pass by the way do pluck her?
verses.ct: So why have you torn down its protective walls, letting everyone who passes by pick its fruit?

verses.kjv: The boar out of the wood doth waste it, and the wild beast of the field doth devour it.
verses.ct: Wild boars from the forest ravage it, and creatures of the field feed on it.

verses.kjv: Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: look down from heaven, and behold, and visit this vine;
verses.ct: We beg you, God of Armies â€” come back to us! Look down from heaven and see what has happened. Take care of this vine!

verses.kjv: And the vineyard which thy right hand hath planted, and the branch that thou madest strong for thyself.
verses.ct: Protect the vineyard that your own right hand planted, the shoot you raised up strong for yourself.

verses.kjv: It is burned with fire, it is cut down: they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance.
verses.ct: It has been set on fire and chopped down; your people are dying under your displeasure.

verses.kjv: Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son of man whom thou madest strong for thyself.
verses.ct: Place your hand of protection on the one at your right side, on the one you raised up strong for yourself.

verses.kjv: So will not we go back from thee: quicken us, and we will call upon thy name.
verses.ct: Then we will never turn away from you. Revive us, and we will call on your name.

verses.kjv: Turn us again, O LORD God of hosts, cause thy face to shine; and we shall be saved.
verses.ct: Restore us, LORD God of Armies! Look on us with favor, and we will be saved.
